DOCNAME: IZZET MEHMET AND OTHERS v. CYPRUS AND OTHER APPLICATIONS
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Päivi Hirvelä;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . A list of the applicants is set out in the appendix .
The applicants are either owners , or the heirs of owners , of property which is governed by the custodianship regime under LAW .

None of the applicants have taken proceedings in the domestic courts or brought such proceedings to a conclusion . The third applicant in no . PERSON claims to have proceedings pending but no documents or details have been provided .

CARDINAL . The first CARDINAL applicants wished to transfer as gift their properties in GPE to their niece and nephew , the third and fourth applicants . On DATE , the Custodian refused permission for the transfer as the properties were classified as NORP - Cypriot properties .

CARDINAL . The applicant was one of the heirs and an administrator of property of his deceased father and mother , NORP Cypriots who fled north in DATE . This property was now being used as a primary school . The applicant contacted the Minister of ORG with a view to claiming his property rights and damages . No response was received .

CARDINAL . The applicants are the heirs and administrators of the estate of CARDINAL deceased Turkish- NORP relatives consisting of a property in GPE . In DATE they discovered the house had been demolished and another building erected . They made an application to ORG for the return of property and payment of loss of use ; the authorities refused .

CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP , bought land in DATE and rented it out . The tenant paid rent until DATE . ORG later expropriated part of the land , building a road down the middle . Under LAW , the Custodian appeared to have terminated the lease with the applicant ’s tenant and rented the property to another person .

CARDINAL . The CARDINAL applicants are NORP , who left GPE either before or in DATE and who owned or have inherited property in the LOC . The third applicant stated that his father ’s property had been expropriated and a bus terminal built there . The second applicant brought court proceedings ( no documents provided ) which he said were still pending ; the other applicants stated that no proceedings were brought due to the failures of their lawyers .

CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP - Cypriot owner of property sold to the ORG , made a claim for compensation for loss of use from DATE to DATE which was refused by the authorities who relied on LAW CARDINAL/CARDINAL . No proceedings were taken .

CARDINAL . The applicant owned , wholly or in part , CARDINAL plots of land in the Republic which he had not been able to use since DATE . CARDINAL plot was used as a Post Office by the authorities and another was rented out as a giftshop without his consent . No proceedings had been taken .

CARDINAL . The applicants are the heirs ( spouse and children ) of the deceased owner of property in GPE . NORP Cypriots have been using the property , a house and shops , since DATE , without their consent .

CARDINAL . The CARDINAL NORP - NORP applicants , who abandoned their homes and property in the village of GPE in DATE , wrote a petition to ORG in DATE for return of land and compensation . No reply was received .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , a NORP - Cypriot who left the south in DATE , owns CARDINAL properties from which she previously collected rents . On DATE , she made a claim to ORG for return of her property ; no answer was received .
CARDINAL . The applicants , NORP Cypriots , own , wholly or in part , QUANTITY plots in the LOC , bought in DATE . Since DATE , they have been unable to use or develop these plots .

CARDINAL . The applicants are heirs of NORP Cypriots who owned property in the south and fled in DATE ; the property had tenants but no rent had been received since . On DATE the applicants applied to the authorities for restitution of their property without success .

CARDINAL . The applicants are heirs of their NORP - Cypriot father who owned a house and business property in GPE . The family left in DATE . Tenants declined to pay rent due to the custodianship regime and gave rents to the authorities . The applicants sought unsuccessfully after the death of their father in DATE to obtain possession of the properties . Some of the property has been demolished , other plots compulsorily acquired by the ORG . No court proceedings were taken .
CARDINAL . The relevant case - law and laws are set out in GPE and Others v Cyprus ( no . CARDINAL et al , § § CARDINAL , decision of CARDINAL DATE ) .
